     "SLAG!" Scourge thought to himself as he watched his prey, so 
much in=
 his sights turn a corner and step out of view. Quickly 
Scourge and the sw=
eep that followed him leaped foward giving pusuit.

((OOC: I am assuming th=
e ready room is just off the bridge?))

Scourge stepped onto the bridge as =
the sweep flanked him, and they 
fanned out, searching for the surprisingly=
 elusive Rodimus. As 
soundlessly as posible they brush aside debris and fa=
llen items until 
they come to the door of the ready room. From inside they=
 can hear a 
discussion . . . 

  
> Rodimus: Reprogram her. Bolster our fo=
rces. We need it. Use and 
> secrets we may learn to our advantage.

 
> "S=
till she's no ready"said dryly Perceptor"Her ceptiviy have
> weaken her and=
 wont survive the process but maybe she needs
> to be convinced, broke her =
resistance.. . her spirit is
> strong... I guess that you will be glad to p=
erform the task"

 
> Rodimus: Of course. Once I make it out of here.

> Pe=
rceptor: "Be careful"said perceptor while he meditated 

A dark chuckling c=
ame from the other side of the door as it 
evaporated seemingly into thin a=
ir. On the other side Scourge and the 
other sweep that was with him stood,=
 weapons drawn, obviously the 
authors of the disappearing door trick.  

"=
Be careful indeed Cybertronian!"

Scourge hit a button on his chest, the al=
l call button, one that 
would call the other few sweeps on the ship to con=
verge on thier 
position from where ever they are on the ship. 

"You will =
be a prize for Cyclonus" Scourge chuckled darkly as he 
spoke, his optics g=
lowing wickedly as he clenched his clawed fingered 
fist, "but first *I* am=
 going to have some fun with you." 

Preston
(Scourge & Sweeps)
